Literature Review: Constructed languages have been a subject of interest in linguistics for several decades, with various types of languages being created for different purposes. This literature review aims to provide an overview of the different types of constructed languages, their characteristics, and the research questions they present. The review will also discuss the role of constructed languages in psycholinguistic experiments and their potential applications in the field of linguistics.

References.title: Conlangs: A Survey of Constructed Languages
The Role of Constructed Languages in Psycholinguistic Experiments
The Construction of Language: A Cognitive Approach
The Construction of Language: A Sociolinguistic Approach
Conlangs: A New Frontier in Linguistics
